alert.note: Alert for Southwest Desert, Lower Gila River Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 13 at 6:04PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Grant and northeastern Hidalgo Counties through 630 PM MDT... At 603 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles north of Separ, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Grant and northeastern Hidalgo Counties. This includes Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 39 and 41. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Southwest Desert, Lower Gila River Valley
